content:
• Friday, January 27, 2012
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy (CLNE +4.8%) falls 2.3% AH, to $14.74, after filing to sell 15M shares held by...

    Clean Energy (CLNE +4.8%) falls 2.3% AH, to $14.74, after filing to sell 15M shares held by insiders at a maximum offering price of $13.91. Boone Pickens will be selling 1.5M shares, thereby lowering his stake in the natural gas fuel provider to 27.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS -10.5%), which fell after providing soft Q1 guidance (revenue of $59M-$64M vs....

    Rambus (RMBS -10.5%), which fell after providing soft Q1 guidance (revenue of $59M-$64M vs. consensus of $70M) to go with its Q4 beat, drops 2.9% AH after the USPTO discloses it invalidated a patent relevant to lawsuits Rambus filed against NVDA, HPQ, and others. With the two other patents relevant to the suits having been invalidated in September, a 2010 licensing deal with Nvidia could be at risk. (Q4 transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • OCR

    The Federal Trade Commission sues to block Omnicare's (NYSE:OCR) bid to acquire PharMerica...

    The Federal Trade Commission sues to block Omnicare's (NYSE:OCR) bid to acquire PharMerica (NYSE:PMC), alleging the deal would lead to higher costs for Medicare patients and taxpayers. PMC -13.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • LPL

    LG Display (LPL +4.3%) closed higher after delivering an encouraging Q4 report. While LG's...

    LG Display (LPL +4.3%) closed higher after delivering an encouraging Q4 report. While LG's $129.3M operating loss was slightly below consensus, revenue of $589M was slightly better. More importantly, LG, which has struggled to cope with weak TV sales, says it sees display panel prices holding steady in Q1, and expects to turn profitable in Q2. iPhone, iPad, and 3D TV panel shipments are expected to give LG a boost. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • MO

    Shares of Altria Group (MO -1.8%) finished the day in the red despite beating Q4 estimates, as...

    Shares of Altria Group (MO -1.8%) finished the day in the red despite beating Q4 estimates, as earnings slid 9% Y/Y due to several charges. Bottom line results managed to beat the Street however, on strong volume growth for smokeless products and a modest increase in demand for cigarettes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • OLED

    Though closing below its morning highs, Universal Display (PANL +2.4%) still managed to...

    Though closing below its morning highs, Universal Display (PANL +2.4%) still managed to outperform on account of top licensee Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) Q4 report. Samsung claims it saw "rapid growth" in its OLED panel business, and say it expects demand for its smartphone display panels (many of which rely on PANL's OLED technology and materials) to remain strong.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • FRAN

    Shares of Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN) finish the day down 4.3% after the company upsized and...

    Shares of Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN) finish the day down 4.3% after the company upsized and priced its follow-on public offering from 9M to 10.4M shares at $23.00 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • CY

    Spansion (CODE +4.6%), already hit hard by the weakness seen in the NOR flash memory market,...

    Spansion (CODE +4.6%), already hit hard by the weakness seen in the NOR flash memory market, rallied today after reporting Q4 revenue of $220M (-33% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.12; the latter missed by a penny, but the former beat by $5.3M. Spansion is guiding for Q1 revenue of $210M-$230M and EPS of $0.01 to $0.07, which compares with Street estimates of $221.8M and -$0.01. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • MEG

    Shares of newspaper publisher and broadcaster Media General (MEG -22%) were hammered today after...

    Shares of newspaper publisher and broadcaster Media General (MEG -22%) were hammered today after the company warned on its conference call that it is "uncomfortable with its ability to remain in compliance" with the terms of its loans. The company is seeking to renegotiate terms with its creditors within two weeks. If a solution can't be found, the company faces the possibility of bankruptcy.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Standard & Poor's places brokerage houses Jefferies (JEF -2.4%), Cantor Fitzgerald and...

    Standard & Poor's places brokerage houses Jefferies (JEF -2.4%), Cantor Fitzgerald and GFI Group on negative outlook, citing the soft market environment for investment banking and institutional sales and trading operations. S&P notes JEF is only modestly exposed to Europe, but the risk of contagion could lower underwriting volumes for all three firms.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • CLS

    Celestica (CLS +4.1%) finishes the day higher despite a mixed Q4 result that missed the mark on...

    Celestica (CLS +4.1%) finishes the day higher despite a mixed Q4 result that missed the mark on revenue. Investors looked past the shortfall however, to concentrate on 80% Y/Y profit growth as revenue-diversification efforts and a focus on operational effectiveness spurred bottom line performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • ALKS

    Shares in partners Alkermes (NASDAQ:ALKS) and Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN) will resume trading...

    Shares in partners Alkermes (NASDAQ:ALKS) and Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN) will resume trading at 4:15 p.m., after a halt this afternoon tied to the FDA's approval of their Bydureon weekly diabetes treatment. Updated 4:16 p.m.: ALKS +3.6% AH; AMLN +14.8% AH. Now for the tough part.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • MX

    MagnaChip (MX +8.8%) jumps after announcing earlier that its Korean subsidiary is acquiring...

    MagnaChip (MX +8.8%) jumps after announcing earlier that its Korean subsidiary is acquiring Dawin Electronics, a privately held South Korean semiconductor company that designs and manufactures Insulated Gate Bipolar Transistor, Fast Recovery Diode and MOSFET modules. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CMCO

    Columbus McKinnon (CMCO +9.3%) pushes higher after reporting Q3 results that beat estimates on...

    Columbus McKinnon (CMCO +9.3%) pushes higher after reporting Q3 results that beat estimates on an 11% Y/Y jump in net profit. Sales were higher across all segments, as the company experienced double digit order growth globally, with particular strength in Europe and the U.S. and Latam markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • AOS

    A.O. Smith (AOS +2.6%) gains after its Q4 beats Street estimates. Revenue was flat compared to...

    A.O. Smith (AOS +2.6%) gains after its Q4 beats Street estimates. Revenue was flat compared to the prior year, but a 30% jump in sales of water heaters in China and strong residential sales in the U.S. helped shore up its bottom line.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • METR

    Metro Bancorp (METR +8.7%) trades higher after reporting Q4 earnings of $0.18 per share, up...

    Metro Bancorp (METR +8.7%) trades higher after reporting Q4 earnings of $0.18 per share, up $0.10 Y/Y and beating analysts' estimates of $0.14 per share. Revenues slipped 2% Y/Y however, to $28.5M, but still beat expectations as core deposits grew 15% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +8.3%) moves up after its FQ2 easily beats estimates, posting a...

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +8.3%) moves up after its FQ2 easily beats estimates, posting a narrower-than-expected loss for the period. Revenue soared 81% Y/Y as the companys product pipeline continues to expand, and partnership agreements with Roche and others begin to bear fruit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • JOE

    Down earlier today after announcing plans to slash capex and sell off land, St. Joe Co. (JOE...

    Down earlier today after announcing plans to slash capex and sell off land, St. Joe Co. (JOE +3.1%) has sharply reversed course. With 60% of St. Joe's float shorted as of Jan. 13, and shares down considerably from last winter's levels, some shorts may be deciding the company's decision to reduce its exposure to a weak Florida real estate market is good reason to cover.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • GSVC

    GSV Capital (GSVC +13.8%) jumps on the report that Facebook would file its IPO this...

    GSV Capital (GSVC +13.8%) jumps on the report that Facebook would file its IPO this week. According to a filing, GSVC owns 225K class B shares of Facebook, valued at $6.59B, which would suggest a ~$70B Facebook valuation. GSVC has been called the closest thing to a pure play on social network IPO candidates. Other stocks moving on the news: QPSA +17.7%, RENN +13.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless International (LEAP -2.3%) says its CFO Walter Berger is leaving the company for...

    Leap Wireless International (LEAP -2.3%) says its CFO Walter Berger is leaving the company for another job in the technology sector shortly after the company reports its full-year results at the end of February.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • NWL

    Newell Rubbermaid (NWL +7%) gets a boost after its Q4 EPS beat estimates today. Profit rose 6.2%...

    Newell Rubbermaid (NWL +7%) gets a boost after its Q4 EPS beat estimates today. Profit rose 6.2% Y/Y as the company posted better sales and stronger demand for its baby-and-parenting products. Demand had been weak in that segment over the past few quarters, hurt by a low birth rate and frugality among parents as the economy faltered.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • DISH

    Dish Network (DISH -3.6%) is selling off, likely thanks to a Detwiler Fenton report claiming the...

    Dish Network (DISH -3.6%) is selling off, likely thanks to a Detwiler Fenton report claiming the satellite TV provider is getting serious about its plans to use its spectrum assets to build out a mobile network, likely in partnership with an existing carrier. Investors fear such a move would be an expensive gamble, and could reduce the near-term likelihood of an AT&T (NYSE:T) bid.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • ELX

    After digesting Emulex's (ELX +14.3%) FQ2 report and rosy guidance, analysts are turning more...

    After digesting Emulex's (ELX +14.3%) FQ2 report and rosy guidance, analysts are turning more bullish. Kaufman initiates coverage with a Buy rating and $12 price target, while ThinkEquity moves its rating up to Buy from Hold. A more restrained Goldman Sachs came in with a modest increase in its PT on shares to $8 - a mark that has already been eclipsed.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • AUTH

    AuthenTec (AUTH +4.2%) gains after announcing it's launched a new fingerprint security solution...

    AuthenTec (AUTH +4.2%) gains after announcing it's launched a new fingerprint security solution for Apple's Mac laptops and desktop computers running on Lion and Snow Leopard operating systems. The device includes an Eikon fingerprint sensor and TrueSuite identity management software and will be available in March.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • RMD

    ResMed (RMD +10.2%), a maker of equipment for treating respiratory disorders, is surging...

    ResMed (RMD +10.2%), a maker of equipment for treating respiratory disorders, is surging following its FQ2 beat. Likely helping matters is an upgrade to Buy from Deutsche, which thinks the rebound seen in ResMed's U.S. equipment sales (Americas revenue rose 12% Y/Y) suggests the company can keep growing earnings at a double-digit annual clip. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG +1.7%) has given back some of the gains it saw following a judge's decision to...

    Transocean (RIG +1.7%) has given back some of the gains it saw following a judge's decision to indemnify the latter against claims it faces related to the Deepwater Horizon spill, perhaps due to concerns about the damages Transocean could still be on the hook for. However, Halliburton (HAL +2.6%), which faces its share of Deepwater-related legal troubles, is holding onto its gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • ARCB

    Arkansas Best (ABFS -16%) gets hammered after its Q4 misses expectations on a 7.6% Y/Y decline...

    Arkansas Best (ABFS -16%) gets hammered after its Q4 misses expectations on a 7.6% Y/Y decline in freight tonnage. Many analysts had expected the company to beat estimates going into the report, after coming off a better-than-expected, though subdued, peak shipping season.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • AAPL

    In the wake of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) blowout FQ1 figures, has the market fully discounted a...

    In the wake of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) blowout FQ1 figures, has the market fully discounted a strong outlook for iPhone sales? The post-earnings selloff seen in audio chipmaker Cirrus Logic (CRUS -6%), which rallied along with other iPhone suppliers on Tuesday, could be a canary in the coal mine. Though Cirrus' FQ4 revenue guidance range of $108M-$112M is above a prior forecast, it wasn't enough to please the Street.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • TKR

    Timken (TKR +4%) rises as its Q4 earnings beat on both EPS and revenue. Profits jumped 21% on...

    Timken (TKR +4%) rises as its Q4 earnings beat on both EPS and revenue. Profits jumped 21% on sales strength in its industrial supply business, as key buyers in automotive, construction and industrial equipment sectors ramped up orders. One of its key contributors was China, as the government made heavy investments infrastructure projects over the period.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • RHI

    Robert Half International (RHI -8.5%) trades lower after its Q4 results missed across the board,...

    Robert Half International (RHI -8.5%) trades lower after its Q4 results missed across the board, as Street estimates appear to have over-reached after seeing profits more than double or triple the last three quarters. The earnings miss masks a 72% Y/Y jump in profit as the company still sees strong demand for staffing in its technology and accounting sectors.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • MRVL

    Marvell (MRVL +2.5%) moves higher despite cutting its Q4 sales guidance due to Thailand flooding...

    Marvell (MRVL +2.5%) moves higher despite cutting its Q4 sales guidance due to Thailand flooding and weak year-end demand among mobile and wireless customers. Analysts at Benchmark and Susquehanna are sticking with the stock, seeing "clear evidence that HDD supply is recovering quickly" based on Western Digital's results, and believing the bad news was known already.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • RVBD

    Needham is staying positive on Riverbed (RVBD -21.1%). The firm points out Riverbed's Q4...

    Needham is staying positive on Riverbed (RVBD -21.1%). The firm points out Riverbed's Q4 deferred revenue and EMEA sales were strong, albeit while noting (as BofA did earlier this week) its U.S. sales are being hurt by declining government orders. Moreover, it thinks strong 2H sales will offset 1H weakness. Riverbed is still guiding for 2012 sales growth of 17%-20% (prior consensus was 19.9%). (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • EMN

    Getting lost in all the merger talk today is a solid Q4 earnings report from Eastman Chemical...

    Getting lost in all the merger talk today is a solid Q4 earnings report from Eastman Chemical (EMN +5.5%). Profit soared as the company racked up revenue growth across virtually all units, led by its performance chemicals and intermediates segment, and an absence of charges that weighed on year-ago results. The company also raises FQ1 guidance above Street estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • CMEDQ

    China Medical Tech (CMED -18.3%) shares swoon following Fitch's downgrade of the company's B+...

    China Medical Tech (CMED -18.3%) shares swoon following Fitch's downgrade of the company's B+ issuer default rating to "RD" after learning of missed coupon payments on bonds.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks' (SBUX -2.5%) FQ1 beat and slight guidance hike aren't enough to prevent some...

    Starbucks' (SBUX -2.5%) FQ1 beat and slight guidance hike aren't enough to prevent some profit-taking from occurring after a strong 5-month rally. Earnings call remarks about commodity costs having a $105M impact on FQ1 operating income could be taking a toll. But Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +6.4%) is adding to the gains it saw yesterday afternoon on account of Starbucks' K-Cup commentary.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • ABAX

    Abaxis (ABAX -7.1%) dips after its FQ3 earnings missed the mark on both revenue and a per share...

    Abaxis (ABAX -7.1%) dips after its FQ3 earnings missed the mark on both revenue and a per share basis. Profit from instrument sales decreased 2% Y/Y, primarily due to a slowdown in its European markets and distributor inventory adjustments.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • CMLP

    Inergy (NRGY -16.8%) says it is evaluating its operating businesses and is in the process of...

    Inergy (NRGY -16.8%) says it is evaluating its operating businesses and is in the process of major cost reductions in its propane units, after reporting distributable cash flow for 2011 covered only 68% of its dividend payments. NRGY leaves its latest distribution the same as previous quarters but says it will consider resetting them to a more sustainable level. NRGM -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN -0.8%) postphones its Q4 and year-end earnings releases - saying that it's...

    Illumina (ILMN -0.8%) postphones its Q4 and year-end earnings releases - saying that it's focused on taking a formal position on the Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) takeover attempt within ten business days. ILMN trades at $52.24 - pricing in an expectation of a better offer than Roche's $44.50 per share somewhere down the road.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • STP

    Solar shares are rising, as CEOs from Suntech (STP +2.8%) and Trina Solar (TSL +4%) say China...

    Solar shares are rising, as CEOs from Suntech (STP +2.8%) and Trina Solar (TSL +4%) say China may double its installations of solar panels this year, absorbing excess production that have depressed prices and margins. Maxim analyst Aaron Crew says Chinese demand is "hopping," adding "China could surpass Germany" as the world’s largest solar market. FSLR +5.2%, JASO +3.4%, SPWR +3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATGE

    Shares of DeVry (DV -7.6%) take a hit after its FQ2 report misses estimates. Earnings plunged...

    Shares of DeVry (DV -7.6%) take a hit after its FQ2 report misses estimates. Earnings plunged 90% Y/Y on a big write-down at its health-care college and a continuing decline in revenue, as admissions wane due to a weak economy and stiffer regulations.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • MWW

    A SEC filing reveals that Monster Worldwide (MWW +3.5%) CEO Salvatore Iannuzzi is a buyer of...

    A SEC filing reveals that Monster Worldwide (MWW +3.5%) CEO Salvatore Iannuzzi is a buyer of shares on the heels of yesterday's weakness.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • DHI

    Shares of D.R. Horton (DHI +2.2%) move higher after the homebuilding firm beats the consensus...

    Shares of D.R. Horton (DHI +2.2%) move higher after the homebuilding firm beats the consensus estimate for FQ1 EPS and hints on its earnings CC that it will buy back shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD -21.6%) crashes for the second time in 6 months (previously), after investors...

    Riverbed (RVBD -21.6%) crashes for the second time in 6 months (previously), after investors fail to be appeased by the company's excuse for its weak Q1 guidance - "product transition" issues related to next-gen hardware for its flagship Steelhead appliance line. A 120 bps Q/Q decline in Riverbed's gross margin in Q4, partly blamed on higher hard drive prices, also isn't going over well. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • WMS-OLD

    WMS Industries (NYSE:WMS-OLD) makes a run despite a double miss with its FQ2 report. Shares are...

    WMS Industries (NYSE:WMS-OLD) makes a run despite a double miss with its FQ2 report. Shares are up 12.5% on heavy volume to hit their highest levels since August of last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics (SYNA +3.9%) moves higher after its FQ2 beat estimates late yesterday, and despite...

    Synaptics (SYNA +3.9%) moves higher after its FQ2 beat estimates late yesterday, and despite guiding FQ3 estimates below Street expectations. Needham upgrades the shares to buy on the report, saying the company is gaining share in the handset space and it sees strong momentum in the tablet market. On the flip side, Sterne Agee cuts the shares to Neutral on valuation, seeing limited near-term upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • JNPR

    Weak Q1 guidance from Juniper (JNPR -9%) is taking a toll on networking equipment makers, as...

    Weak Q1 guidance from Juniper (JNPR -9%) is taking a toll on networking equipment makers, as investors fear a broad-based slowdown in service provider spending is underway. CSCO -1.9%. ARUN -1.4%. APKT -1.7%. CIEN -2.5%. ALLT -3%. (JNPR transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • OCLR

    In spite of beating FQ2 estimates, Oclaro (OCLR -9%) is selling off today, as the Street focuses...

    In spite of beating FQ2 estimates, Oclaro (OCLR -9%) is selling off today, as the Street focuses on the optical component maker's underwhelming FQ3 guidance (revenue of $90M-$97M vs. consensus of $115M), likely affected by soft telecom capex. Falling in sympathy: JDSU -3.7%. FNSR -2.5%. OPXT -1.8%. NPTN -1.9%. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • GDOT

    The bottom line is all that matters as shares of Green Dot (GDOT -5.8%) trade lower after...

    The bottom line is all that matters as shares of Green Dot (GDOT -5.8%) trade lower after missing on its Q4 revenue, despite a 77% Y/Y jump in earnings and raising its 2012 guidance. The company also announced recent multi-year extensions to exclusive distribution agreements with Rite-Aid and Kmart, two of its most important long-term retail partners.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • APEN

    Shares of Lpath (LPTN.OB -31.8%) plummet after the biotech company temporarily suspends trials...

    Shares of Lpath (LPTN.OB -31.8%) plummet after the biotech company temporarily suspends trials for its PEDigree and Nexus lipidomics-based antibody therapeutics. LPTN says it took the action when it learned its fill/finish contractor was not in FDA compliance for manufacturing requirements. (submitted by M.E. Garza)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • CCL

    Costa Cruises says it will offer $14K to every passenger of the shipwrecked Costa Concordia to...

    Costa Cruises says it will offer $14K to every passenger of the shipwrecked Costa Concordia to cover lost baggage and "psychological trauma" in a bid by parent Carnival (CCL +0.5%) to cut short potential class action lawsuits. Shares of CCL have fallen 15% since the deadly accident, while analysts continue to gnash out (I, II) the financial impact to the firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • ESIO

    Shares of Electro Scientific Industries (ESIO -9.4%) move sharply lower after the firm releases...

    Shares of Electro Scientific Industries (ESIO -9.4%) move sharply lower after the firm releases an outlook for FQ4 that tips to the light side. The firm expects revenue in the mid-$40Ms and EPS to falling in a range of $0.05-$0.10.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • FRFHF

    Canada's Warren Buffett, Prem Watsa of Fairfax Financial (OTCPK:FRFHF), has taken a large stake...

    Canada's Warren Buffett, Prem Watsa of Fairfax Financial (OTCPK:FRFHF), has taken a large stake in troubled Canadian company Research in Motion (RIMM +2.6%). Watsa is known for betting against financial firms (and making billions) ahead of the financial meltdown and taking Fairfax from $4/share in the mid-1980s it to more than $400/share today. (submitted by Devon Shire)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 4 Comments
  • JOE

    Following a management overhaul pushed by Bruce Berkowitz, St. Joe Co. (JOE -5.6%) says it's...

    Following a management overhaul pushed by Bruce Berkowitz, St. Joe Co. (JOE -5.6%) says it's adopting a new investment strategy, one that will reduce future capex on existing projects by ~$190M, and could result in properties being "sold in bulk, in undeveloped parcels, or at lower price points." Due to the shift, St. Joe expects to record non-cash charges of $325M-$375M for Q4 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • KLAC

    Though near its 52-week high, KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) is up 2.3% after beating FQ2 estimates,...

    Though near its 52-week high, KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) is up 2.3% after beating FQ2 estimates, and guiding on its earnings call for FQ3 revenue of $770M-$830M ($684M consensus) and EPS of $1-$1.18 ($0.82 consensus). In-line with recent analyst notes (I, II), KLA claims it's seeing strong demand from chip foundries, as growing mobile chip production drives them to invest in cutting-edge manufacturing gear.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • JCP

    All the hubbub at J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) catches the eyes of analysts, as Piper Jaffray upgrades...

    All the hubbub at J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) catches the eyes of analysts, as Piper Jaffray upgrades shares to Overweight and Argus raises its price target to $49 from $38. Shares of JCP -0.7% premarket, after knocking out a 18.8% gain yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 2 Comments
  • DX

    Shares of Dynex Capital (NYSE:DX) lose 4% premarket after the firm prices a stock offering of...

    Shares of Dynex Capital (NYSE:DX) lose 4% premarket after the firm prices a stock offering of 12.5M shares in a deal that is expected to close before Feb. 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • SOA

    Premarket gainers: SOA +42%. CPHD +23%. EMN +8%. RIG +7%. HAL +4%. KLAC +4%. CTIC +4%. CIFX +3%....

    Premarket gainers: SOA +42%. CPHD +23%. EMN +8%. RIG +7%. HAL +4%. KLAC +4%. CTIC +4%. CIFX +3%. STX +3%.
    Losers: RVBD -18%. JNPR -10%. IDIX -9%. F-5 CLF -5%. DX -4%. FRAN -3%. GSS -3%. GM -3%. CRH -3%. MWR -3%. NOK -3%. MRVL -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • EMN

    Eastman Chemical (NYSE:EMN) rallies off the news that the firm snapped up Solutia (NYSE:SOA) and...

    Eastman Chemical (NYSE:EMN) rallies off the news that the firm snapped up Solutia (NYSE:SOA) and that the deal will add an immediate boost to earnings. Shares of EMN +8.7% premarket, while SOA jumps 41.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) -9.6% after Stifel Nicolaus downgrades shares to Sell from...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) -9.6% after Stifel Nicolaus downgrades shares to Sell from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus, which believes the "significant difference" in potency existing between IDIX's hepatitis C drug and those made by Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS) and Inhibitex (NASDAQ:INHX) has important implications on how remaining "potential consolidators" strategically view the companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
